title: Parallel Line Angle Theorems

steps.prompt: Construct two parallel lines and a transversal.
Label corresponding and alternate interior angles.
Explain why the angles are congruent or supplementary.

successCriteria: Learner explains angle relationships with a justified argument.

title: Triangle Congruence Criteria

steps.prompt: Construct two triangles that satisfy SSS or SAS.
Use rigid motions to align the triangles.
Explain which criteria guarantee congruence.

successCriteria: Learner uses transformations to argue triangle congruence.

title: Dynamic Circle Theorems

steps.prompt: Draw chords and tangents from a point on a circle.
Measure inscribed and central angles.
State and justify the relationship between the angles and arcs.

successCriteria: Learner demonstrates circle properties with measurements and reasoning.

title: Coordinate Geometry Proofs

steps.prompt: Plot a quadrilateral with given coordinates.
Compute slopes to determine parallel or perpendicular sides.
Summarize your argument in a brief proof.

successCriteria: Learner proves properties using coordinate relationships.

title: Volume by Slicing

steps.prompt: Sketch parallel slices of a solid.
Use Cavalieri's principle to compare with a known volume.
Explain how slicing models the volume.

successCriteria: Learner models volume with cross sections and justifies the estimate.

title: Modeling with Geometry

steps.prompt: Analyze a design brief and identify constraints.
Draft a geometric model satisfying the constraints.
Reflect on assumptions and approximations.

successCriteria: Learner creates and critiques a mathematical model.

title: Construct an Equilateral Triangle Inscribed in a Circle

steps.prompt: Place the circle's center point O.
With center O, draw a circle through point A.
Mark intersection B on the circle using the same radius.
Connect A–B–C to form △ABC.
Explain why AB = BC = CA (typed or mic).

successCriteria: All three sides equal within tolerance, all vertices on circle, explanation submitted.
